author: Eleni Stavroulakis Meininger
text: 'Average experience. We had a party in the private room. Nice atmosphere
column5: but the lights were very dim. The restroom lights were dim also
column6: which is a bad sign as far as cleanliness goes. Drink service was good
column7: food service was slow. Food was ok
column8: although my crabcake and poached eggs were missing the crabcake
column9: and instead I got an overly toasted and stale English muffin

author: Probal DasGupta
text: 'Good food. Great service. Excellent location right on the Hudson. It had become a favorite place for a social lunch event for some of us. We typically occupy the high table at the right hand corner just by the full glass wall overlooking the Hudson. Also very easy parking all around and in the garage right across the restaurant. Totally recommended.'

author: Danny Severino
text: 'The steaks are average at best. $55 for an 8 ounce filet is absolutely ridiculous. $32 for one glass of their house Pinot noir as well. I only saw our waiter 2 times and couldn‚Äôt even get a fork when I asked for one. There are many better options than this place in Hoboken.'

author: Pete Maglicic
text: 'We had a party of 10 for a celebratory dinner. While the food was decent
column5: the service was the worst I have ever experienced at a high scale steakhouse. No chance I ever go back there again.'

author: Peggy Winkler
text: 'Fantastic  staff and food.  Presentation is everything and the chef did a great job as well.  Everyone in our party was surprised how great their food tasted.'

author: Tasha
text: 'I went there for my Birthday dinner. I will applaud them for being so accommodating to us when we booked last min and was running late and had to push the time back. I had a great time the food was good and our waitress was nice
column5: attentive & hospitable. Right outside the restaurant they have a cute little park/ lookout area with a nice view of NYC skyline. overall
column6: I did enjoy myself. They even gave me a cute little dessert at the end with a candle for my birthday.\n\nMy only downfall for that night was that I left my brand new AirPods that I received as a birthday gift that night at the restaurant right by my seat. I tried calling that night but no response so I called the next day around their open time and was told no one found it. That was bitter sweet for me because I had such a good time
column7: just for it to be ruined by losing such my birthday gift. A pricey one at that.'

author: Probal DasGupta
text: 'Great location on the Hudson. Great ambiance. Excellent service. Good food . Good selection of wines. Ready parking nearby. Excellent.'

author: eymen gamer
text: 'I had Lemon Dill Salmon. It was delicious.'

author: Cynthia Andino
text: 'Great espresso martinis ! Great truffle Mac and cheese !!'

author: Irene Cespedes
text: 'Food was top notch and very fulfilling
column5: service was great as well. The drink are good too'

author: Wanborch Bastien
text: 'Had a memorable night there. Service on point
column5: have it by the river‚Ä¶ Grill is always a good choice üëçüèæ'

author: Frank Guzman
text: 'What an experience it was and the steak was out of this world...Family friendly ambiance and great attending waiters & waitresses...WOW!!!'

author: Yanira Otero
text: 'Awesome food! The best Truffle Mac and Cheese ever!'

author: AM Melendez
text: 'Good food and service'

author: Adriana Puga
text: 'Great lunch spot on the waterfront'

author: Christian Richard
text: "A steakhouse that doesn't know how to prepare steak. Medium apparently means barely cooked nowadays. Weak."

author: Nia Daye
text: "Been to a Del Frisco's before (in Philly)
column5: but this was my first time at this location in Hoboken. Went for a private brunch party for my best friend's 30th. I got there a little later
column6: but we all a good dining experience.\n\nShe did a pre-fixed menu to make things easier since there were at least 20 of us. I ordered the Chicken & Waffles entree without the bacon (they gave me that option)
column7: and many other people in our group ordered that as well. We all enjoyed it and felt the dish was very tasty
column8: with the waffle having a nice crisp to it. I also had a piece of the Cinnamon Rolls since someone sit near me shared and
column9: as someone who doesn't usually eat cinnamon buns
column10: it was pretty good! It was very rich in taste and warm. We also ordered a number of drinks throughout the brunch. I had a couple of Mimosas
column11: the Margarita and Manhattan cocktails on the menu - all made well and tasted just right.\n\nIf looking for a nice brunch or dinner for a special occasion (small or large)

author: D Michael
text: 'So amazingly bad
column5: the worst possible experience of any semi fine restaurant I have ever eaten. To be fair the appetizer course was good across the board very good. My drinks (old fashioned and margarita) were terrible. My medium ribeye came out as a strip and as I waited forever to get it corrected it got cold and when it went back to the kitchen it was turned around and sent back out with every assurance it was a ribeye.\nOver all this was the saddest experience
column6: I only wish I had time to write about the experience.\nSo to conclude I‚Äôd rather eat glass than return to this restaurant.'

author: MR Bellio (Thumper)
text: 'SO sad... I waited for a long time to eat at this place. It was horrible. Waiter was a absolute slob and his service was some of the worst I\'ve had. We rarely got refills
column5: orders were wrong and to be completely honest the food wasn\'t worth the price. Dessert was the most depressing- I tried the Lemon cake they are "famous" for- I think it was just leftover cake from a Betty Crocker instant cake mix. This restaurant was SO BAD- I won\'t even give them a second chance. I mean- 600$ bill and waiter was untucked
column6: foul mouthed and poor hygiene-'

author: Jason Sajdak
text: 'Absolutely. 100%. Certified. Terrible. From parking to wait staff.  No parking.  Table was placed in an area where we couldnt talk across the table
column5: asked the manager about it as i have slight hearing loss
column6: his response was "I just wont talk to you then".  Food was highly mediocre at best
column7: online menu isn\'t updated to the current availability.  Water is not refillable unless its been a 1/2 hour.  Tried to pass off NY strip as ribeye. Rude and inconsiderate. Took 25 minutes to cash out.'

author: billpsu92
text: 'A great choice for corporate entertaining
column5: with a neat location across from the New York City Sky Line.  Our meals were good and no complaints...The Lobster Macaroni & Cheese maybe the best ever!\n\nService was good and one item was missed but the server team quickly resolved.'

author: Mohamed Mustafa
text: 'This place was great the staff are friendly my waiter was a gentlemen named Eyad he was very professional and most importantly made the guest with me happy by providing excellent service. Looking forward to coming back soon can‚Äôt wait to have more cheesesteak egg rolls üòãüòãüòãüòãüòã'

author: kate dubitski
text:
'Steaks were oversalted. The bread pudding was amazing.
Service overall was good but the prices felt too steep for the quality.

Recently we passed near the place when someone at our party needed to use the restroom. They were turned away.
If we considered going back there
column5: we no longer do.'

author: Ash Kat
text: 'We had the worst experience tonight for a birthday celebration.(No birthday song) From the moment we walked in we were treated poorly. Now I understand the rule of having to wait until majority of the party arrives however parking is terrible. The place was not crowded so it should have been no reason not to seat us. The manager for the night was rude from the jump. Our waiter was nice and did all he could. We had a issue with some of the entrees and the waiter tried to rectify but the kitchen was closed but we was never notified of this. The manager came come over and asked what was going on and when we advised he stated ‚Äúlike it told you the kitchen closed at 10‚Äù but he never told any of us this. He then proceeded to say was there anything else and didn‚Äôt even attempt to fix what was wrong. I was really appalled by this treatment and I told him it was no need for that type of treatment. He then walked away. Apparently made changes to the bill but that did not suffice for how we were treated. This place came highly recommended but I will never patronize this place again!! The manager made this the worst experience ever!! Need to learn how to provide better customer service.'

author: Lois Doiron
text: 'Service was great. Price was AWESOME.'

author: Joe Panchella
text: 'The food and waitstaff were great'

author: Eddie Oxendine
text: "Del Frisco's was over the top.. All that you could ask for in a restaurant.. Thank you all staff"

author: Catherine Nakor-Tetteh
text: 'Love this restaurant. Definitely have to make a reservation before heading out there. The ambiance
column5: drinks and food portion sizes were great!! Nice location and there‚Äôs a paid parking garage across the street. Jumbo crab cake and Mac n cheese is a must try.'

author: Jose Rosario
text: 'The people here are very nice and they give great service. The wings I had was very good and the rest of my coworkers had different things but everyone was satisfied with their meals. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.'

author: Zenon Piotrowski
text: 'Had the prime rib done Medium.  Very flavorful and not tough. Very enjoyable.  Have it with the mushrooms!'

author: Monishasree C V
text: 'Came here for dinner. Waiting time was around 15 min usually in peaks hours it extends. Food was good and Ambience was ok. Service was great. Price was too high.'

author: Chelsea Michelle
text: 'Very disappointed. Came here for my birthday last night & both the service and food were terrible. Definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend.'

author: PH ST
text: 'Fantastic service...on point all they through'

author: Kimberly ‚Äú ‚Äù Watson
text: 'Excellent food and drinks. The white sangria with the strawberry popsicle was a favorite. Dinner was a special...Branzino with arugula salad.'

author: David Rotner
text: 'Appetizers are good. Entrees are not. Service is pretty terrible. Suggestion: go somewhere else.'

author: Pearson Yam
text: "Below average
column5: was almost like an Applebee's.  Not worth the money. We ordered a Chicken sandwich and a cheeseburger. Chicken sandwich was decent
column6:
like a bigger shake shack Chicken sandwich. The cheeseburger was pretty bad. Something about the beef just tasted so average it was like I ordered a big mac from a McDonald's instead of a high end restaurant. Couldn't even finish it.  At least a big mac actually tastes good.

The service was also nonexistent. The waiter didn't even introduce himself. Came once to get our drink orders and once more for food. That was it. Like seriously? For a 3 dollar sign restaurant I expected much better.

The fries were the one redeeming thing about the whole experience
column7:
but it wasn't enough to offset everything else. DON'T ORDER THE BEEF HERE IT'S TERRIBLE.

The only reason I would come back would be to try their tuna tacos and Asian tuna salad. Will be doing take out next time though.

EDIT:
@DelFrisco's reply asking for feedback

Man did you even read my review..? The beef was BAD. And the service was BAD."

author: Christine Daly
text: 'Just delicious'

author: Sarah Murtagh
text: '5 stars for our server Patrick! I was indecisive about ordering so I asked Patrick his opinion of the menu and ended up having him surprise me with one of his favorite menu items (the cheeseburger). His choice did not disappoint! After such a good suggestion
column5: my husband and I had him pick our dessert as well and again 10/10! Patrick was kind
column6: conversational and very attentive to us and we will definitely come back for his service üëåüèº Thank you

author: Scott Spratt
text: "Was okay

column6: I had the side of mushrooms which was great.\nWe will stick to the steak next time"

author: Navaraj Dhakal
text: 'Great food
column5: nice atmosphere and good hospitality!'

author: Chantell Rivera
text: 'I am rating this place on experience alone. We requested to sit outside and there were plenty of tables empty. The hostess said he didn‚Äôt have a waitress for out there but my significant other didn‚Äôt hear him. He asked why couldn‚Äôt we sit outside if there were a bunch of empty tables. The hostess proceeded to peer down at my significant other
column5: made a face and said ‚ÄúJust because I have empty tables doesn‚Äôt mean I have anyone to serve them‚Äù. At that moment I said we will find another restaurant
column6: you are rude. I feel like they treated us that way because we were patrons of color and there weren‚Äôt any in that place. I will never visit this establishment again.'

text: 'Mmmm the ribeye was delicious. Also cant go wrong with there crab-cakes.'

text: 'Very chill atmosphere

column7: steak sandwich and mushroom flatbread. Steak was a bit dry otherwise the other items were delicious. I like that lunch option includes a "pick two" where you can get an appetizer+half main to taste more of their menu.'

author: Ryan
text: 'Middle of the summer and it‚Äôs not much cooler inside than it is outside. Really starts the experience off with the wrong impression. Our server was not interested in the service she was providing
column5: at all
column6: at any point during our visit. Our food was delivered
column7: 9 minutes later she arrived to ask if everything was ok - we both asked for refills
column8: and received them 16 minutes later. Maybe that‚Äôs nitpicky
column9: but our food was done and we requested the bill. Again
column10: 15 minutes to get the bill.\n\nThis only leaves the food as a last leg for this place to stand on as the environment and service are pathetic at best. To call the food mediocre would be a stretch compliment for the presentation and quality. I‚Äôm not sure what anyone is getting here or experiencing that they‚Äôd give this place 4+ stars
column11: but that just wasn‚Äôt our experience from any angle.\n\nI don‚Äôt care to hear some generic apology from the restaurant because there‚Äôs absolutely no way we will ever return. I also urge anyone else considering this poorly run establishment to exercise better judgement and try something else.'

author: Maxim Sorin
text: "The service was fine
column5: the food was not. A better choice would be Applebee's
column6: cheaper and a slightly better quality of food. I ordered a steak medium rare
column7: came medium well with a thick layer of pepper paste. Overpriced and not worth it. Avoid."

author: Yonathan Perez
text: 'The service and location are nice
column5: but the food and drinks are subpar for the price. You‚Äôre getting Applebee‚Äôs quality for a nice New York City steakhouse prices.'

author: Melissa M
text: "I really enjoy the Del Frisco's in the city and was excited to try the Hoboken location
column5: but the experience was a little disappointing. They ran out of the 10 Oz sirloin
column6: which happens
column7: but a little weird at a steakhouse... The New York Strip was cooked perfectly inside but the outside was charred on both steaks we ordered. They also only include one price on their cocktail menu for $10
column8: which gives me the impression that their drinks range from $10-15. However
column9: my cocktail ended up being around $20. I really don't mind spending money on good drinks
column10: but it felt purposefully misleading and contributed to the overall meh experience. Service was good though!"

author: sam batca
text: "If you're going for the view... Don't. But the food was good."

author: Shaad Smith
text: 'Took my wife here for her Birthday

author: Silvia Santini
text: "DelFrisco's use to be our favorite dinning restaurant in Hoboken
column5: with the views
column6: service and food
column7: but unfortunately this has all changed. To our shock
column8: on a beautiful holiday weekend we were told the outdoor patio was closed. Their prices skyrocketed as all other aspects have declined. We hope they will get back to the place we once enjoyed üòû."

author: Joe Diaz
text: 'Filet mignon seasonin was good. Nice apps and truffle mac and cheese also good.'

author: Miguel Alvarez
text: 'Food was ok

author: Matthew Veltri
text: "Excellent fine dining establishment with a good view of the Hudson & NYC Skyline across the street. Came here to relax and unwind after a stressful 2020 and spend time with family and we were not disappointed. Service was fantastic
column5: and food and drinks exceeded expectations. If you pay visit
column6: be sure to try their Cheesesteak Eggrolls
column8: and any of their steak options (seasoning and tenderness is perfect). Can also never go wrong with Red Sangria either. Overall
column9: Del Frisco's Grille checked all the boxes for a fine dining restaurant close to the Hudson. Will definitely be back soon for a special occasion!"
